title: Twin Figures

thumbnail.alt_text: Painting of multicolored rectangles and irregular interlocking shapes.

publication_history:
Whyte Gallery, Hélion, exh. cat. (Washington D.C.: The Whyte Gallery, 1939), n.p., no. 10, as Figures jumelles, 1938.

Meyer Schapiro, Hélion: Recent Paintings, exh. cat. (New York: Gallery Georgette Passedoit, 1940), n.p., no. 11., as Figures jumelles.

J.W.L.,“The Splendid Tones in Helion’s Abstractions,” The Art News 38, 26 (1940), p. 16 (ill.), as Figures jumelles.

Arts Club of Chicago, Hélion, exh. cat. (Chicago: Arts Club, 1943), n. p., no. 1, as Figures jumelles.

Edward Alden Jewell, “French War Art on Exhibition Here,” New York Times (February 9, 1943), p. 26, as Figures jumelles.

James Johnson Sweeney, Hélion, exh. cat. (New York: Art of This Century Gallery, 1943), n.p., no. 9, as Figures jumelles.

Art Institute, Paintings in The Art Institute of Chicago: A Catalogue of the Picture Collection (Chicago: Art Institute, 1961), p. 214, as Twin Figures, 1938.

Gallery of Modern Art, Paintings by Jean Hélion, 1928–1964, exh. cat. (New York: Foundation for Modern Art, 1964), p. 37, no. 14, as Twin Figures, 1939.

Grand Palais, Jean Hélion: Cent tableaux 1928–1970, exh. cat. (Paris: Centre National d’Art Contemporain, 1970), p. 37 (ill.), as Figures jumelles, 1938.

Daniel Abadie, Hélion, ou la force des choses (Brussels: La Connaissance, 1975), p. 48 (ill.), as Figures jumelles, 1938.

René Micha, Hélion (Paris: Flammarion, 1979), pp. 26 (ill.), 96, as Figures jumelles, 1938. 

James A. Speyer and Courtney Graham Donnell, Twentieth-Century European Paintings (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1980), p. 45, cat. 2B1, as Twin Figures, 1938.

Melvin Paul Lader, “Peggy Guggenheim’s Art of This Century: The Surrealist Milieu and the American Avant-Garde, 1942–1947” (Ph.D. diss., University of Delaware, 1981), p. 371, no. 9. 

Galerie Karl Flinker, Hélion: Œuvres récentes 1982–1983, exh. cat. (Paris: Galerie Karl Flinker, 1983), n.p., as Figures jumelles.

Armin Zweite, Jean Hélion: Abstraktion und Mythen des Alltags, Bilder, Zeichnungen, Gouachen 1925–1983, exh. cat. (Munich: Städtische Galerie, 1984), pp. 178, cat. 62, 179 (ill.), as Zwillingsfiguren (Figures jumelles), 1938.

Musée d’art moderne de la ville de Paris, Jean Hélion: Peintures et dessins, 1925–1983, exh. cat. (Musée d’art moderne de la ville de Paris, 1984), pp. 74, 75 (ill.) 180, cat. 62, as Figures jumelles.

Fred Licht, ed., Omaggio a Jean Hélion: Opere recenti (Venice: Peggy Guggenheim Collection, 1986), p. 11 (ill.), as Figures jumelles, 1938.

Henry-Claude Cousseau, Hélion (Paris: Editions du Regard, 1992), pp. 45, 83 (ill.), 314 (ill.), as Figures jumelles, 1938.

Jean Paul Bouillon, et. al., L’art du XXe siècle, 1900–1939 (Paris: Citadelles & Mazenod, 1996), p. 341, no. 156, ill. 

Philippe Dagen, Hélion (Paris: Éditions Hazan, 2004), pp. 121, n.p. (ill.), no. 70, 124, as Figures jumelles, 1938.

Centre Georges Pompidou, Jean Hélion, exh. cat. (Paris: Adagp, 2004), pp. 98 (ill.), 225, as Figures jumelles, 1938.

Philippe Monsel, ed., Jean Hélion: 1904–1987 (Paris: Éditions Cercle d’Art, 2004), n.p., fig. 16 (ill.), as Figures jumelles, 1938. 

Jasper Sharp, “Serving the Future: The Exhibitions at Art of This Century 1942–1947,” in Susan Davidson and Philip Rylands, ed., Peggy Guggenheim & Frederick Kiesler: The Story of Art of this Century  (Venice: Peggy Guggenheim Collection and Vienna: Austrian Frederick and Lillian Kiesler Private Foundation, 2004), p. 349 n. 53, as Figures jumelles, 1938.
exhibition_history:
Washington, D.C., The Whyte Gallery, Hélion, November 6–30, 1939, no. 10, as Figures jumelles, 1938.

New York, Gallery Georgette Passedoit, Hélion: Recent Paintings, March 25–April 6, 1940, no. 11., as Figures jumelles, 1938.

Arts Club of Chicago, Hélion, January 6–27, 1943, no. 1, as Figures jumelles.

New York, Art of This Century, Hélion, February 8–March 6, 1943, no. 9, as Figures jumelles, 1938.

New York, Gallery of Modern Art, Paintings by Jean Hélion, 1928–1964, November 3–December 27, 1964, no. 14, as Twin Figures, 1939.

Paris, Grand Palais, Jean Hélion: Cent tableaux 1928–1970, December 11, 1970–February 1, 1971, no cat. no., as Figures jumelles, 1938.

Munich, Städtische Galerie im Lenbachhaus, Jean Hélion: Abstraktion und Mythen des Alltags: Bilder, Zeichnungen, Gouachen 1925–1983, August 29–October 21, 1984, no. 62, as Zwillingsfiguren (Figures jumelles), 1938; traveled to Paris, Musée d'Art Moderne de la Ville de Paris, November 15, 1984–January 6, 1985; and Lisbon, Fundacão Calouste Gulbenkian, February 1985.

Dusseldorf, Kunstsammlung Nordrhein-Westfalen, Entartete Kunst, December 4, 1987–January 31, 1988.

Paris, Centre Georges Pompidou, Centre national d’art et de culture, Jean Hélion, December 8, 2004–March 6, 2005, no cat. no., as Figures jumelles; traveled to 
Barcelona, Museu Picasso, March 17, 2005–June 19, 2005; and New York, National Academy of Design, July 14, 2005–October 9, 2005.
provenance_text: Peggy Guggenheim, probably acquired directly from the artist, by 1956–57 [letter from Peggy Guggenheim to D.C. Rich, Nov. 15, 1956, in curatorial file]; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1957.
